definition: poetry in the style of 離騷|离骚[Li2 Sao1]
trouble/disturbance/rumpus/flirty/coquettish/abbr. for 離騷|离骚[Li2 Sao1]/literary writings/smell of urine/foul smell/male (animal) (dialect)

sentences.english: Compared with Nan dynasties, the works of Sao Style have its own characteristic, though its quantity is not too large.
sentences.chinese: 北朝骚体之作数量不多，但与南朝相比自有其特色。

definition: On Encountering Sorrow, poem by Qu Yuan 屈原[Qu1 Yuan2] in Songs of Chu 楚辭|楚辞[Chu3 ci2]
Chu Ci, the Songs of Chu (ancient book of poems, collected during Han but esp. from country of Chu c. 500 BC)
regular verse/strict poetic form with eight lines of 5, 6 or 7 syllables and even lines rhyming
a genre of poetry, developed in the Tang Dynasty, characterized by its strict form
same as 近體詩|近体诗[jin4 ti3 shi1]
long poem in lüshi form 律詩|律诗
verse form consisting of 8 lines of 7 syllables, with rhyme on alternate lines/abbr. to 七律
